content.question: The graph of the increasing differentiable function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Also shown is the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 2 comma 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the inverse of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements about <math alttext="g prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="g prime of 2, equals two thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="g prime of 2, equals three halves" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="g prime of 4, equals two thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="g prime of 4, equals three halves" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="g prime of 4, equals two thirds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
